DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Second Biospecimen Source Site Staff Quality Control Examined Person Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the second BSS staff that performed a biospecimen quality control inspection.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Second Biospecimen Source Site Staff Quality Control Examined
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Where something is available or from where it originates._A position in relation to its surroundings._The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task._The operational techniques and activities undertaken within the quality assurance system to verify that the requirements for quality of the trial related activities have been fulfilled. [ICH]_Having been subjected to inspection or evaluation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
Where something is available or from where it originates.
A position in relation to its surroundings.
The employees of an organization; personnel who assist their superior in carrying out an assigned task.
Set of measurements and inspections taken to verify that performance of equipment and procedures remains within specified limits.
Having been subjected to inspection or evaluation.
